benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

covered: Valid Request: Extensive happy-path coverage across objectType, fieldName, fieldValue, and their combinations (TC01–TC06, TC37); response schema asserted at least at a high level.
Empty Response: Covered via no matches, empty DB, and offset beyond data size (TC11, TC22, TC28).
Pagination: Covered for typical and large values, including boundaries and windowing (TC07, TC21, TC22).
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid params, extra params ignored, and security hardening (SQLi/XSS) (TC02–TC06, TC08–TC10, TC12–TC16, TC19–TC20).
Audit behavior: FULL/MINIMAL/NONE covered plus regression check for FULL and integration/degraded dependency behaviors (TC08–TC10, TC26, TC32–TC33).
Resilience and Ops: Dependency outage 503, transient network recovery, concurrency, performance under normal/peak and heavy load (TC18, TC23–TC24, TC30–TC31, TC36).
Quality and Docs: Descriptive error responses and documentation clarity (TC34–TC35).
Backward compatibility and regression scenarios present (TC25–TC27).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Cache-Control/Expires headers; no 304 Not Modified validation.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for burst traffic leading to 429 and Retry-After headers.

Defaults and Content-Type: No verification of default offset=0, limit=100, or audit=NONE when omitted; TC01 expects “all custom fields,” which may contradict default limit. Content-Type application/json not asserted.
Type validation: No tests for non-integer offset/limit (e.g., offset=abc), extremely large values (near int64 max), or boolean coercion for fieldValue.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized users/tenants.
Content negotiation: No Accept header tests (e.g., Accept=text/plain leading to 406, or honoring Accept=application/json).
Pagination determinism: No assertion of stable/defined ordering; pagination not combined with filters to validate correct windowing after filtering.
Case and encoding: No tests for case sensitivity/normalization (objectType lowercase/mixed case), trimming/empty strings, URL-encoded or Unicode field names/values.
Error response schema: While descriptive errors are checked, not all error responses assert standardized fields (code/message/details) consistently for each 4xx/5xx case.
Parameter repetition/ambiguity: No tests for repeated query keys (e.g., objectType=ACCOUNT&objectType=INVOICE) or conflicting params handling.
Audit MINIMAL/NONE field-level assertions: FULL has explicit regression validation (TC26), but MINIMAL/NONE lack exact field assertions per schema.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify Cache-Control/ETag headers on 200; re-issue request with If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified; ensure caching disabled/enabled per policy.
Add rate-limiting tests: send bursts to trigger 429 and validate Retry-After; ensure well-behaved clients are not throttled under normal load.

Correct/augment defaults and headers: replace TC01 with expectations aligned to default limit (e.g., returns up to 100); add a scenario to verify default offset=0 and audit defaults to NONE; assert Content-Type=application/json.
Expand type validation: invalid types for offset/limit (abc), very large values (e.g., 9,223,372,036,854,775,7), and boolean parsing for fieldValue; ensure proper 400/422 and safe handling.
Authorization breadth: add 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized user/tenant; verify error body schema.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept header variations (json vs unsupported) and 406 behavior; verify response honors Accept=application/json.
Pagination ordering: define/verify sort order (e.g., createdDate ASC); add test combining filters + pagination to ensure windowing after filtering.
Case/encoding robustness: tests for objectType in lower/mixed case, fieldName/fieldValue with whitespace, URL-encoded and Unicode values; define case sensitivity expectations.
Standardize error schema assertions: for each 4xx/5xx path (invalid params, auth, dependency failure), assert error code/message/details fields and content.
Ambiguous params: test repeated query keys to document and enforce behavior (use last/first or reject).
Audit field assertions: add explicit field-level checks for MINIMAL and NONE per schema to ensure exact presence/absence of audit attributes.
